intro: Keraselma retusum, commonly known as the rough-leaved keraselma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often rough to the touch. Its small, white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the wet season. Keraselma retusum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
